meanings.definition: To replace the face or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: I will reface the old cabinets to make them look new.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will reface the kitchen countertops with a shiny material.
meanings.sent3: After the makeover, the kitchen will reface its tired appearance.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reface her life by starting a new career.
meanings.sent5: The magician used his wand to reface the playing cards before the trick.

meanings.definition: To renovate or update the appearance of something by replacing its surface.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to reface the building's exterior to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: Homeowners often reface their fireplace to give the living room a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The artist wanted to reface the mural with brighter colors for a modern touch.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reface her wardrobe by donating old clothes and buying new ones.
meanings.sent5: The chef will reface the dessert with a sprinkle of powdered sugar for a decorative touch.

meanings.definition: The act of replacing the face or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The reface of the building's facade made it stand out in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: A professional reface of the sign improved its visibility from the road.
meanings.sent3: The reface of the clock tower brought new life to the town square.
meanings.sent4: The reface of the old painting revealed vibrant colors hidden underneath.
meanings.sent5: The reface of the smartphone screen made it look brand new.
